initial_contact.target_demographic: WhatsApp users interested in cryptocurrency trading

tactics: WhatsApp investment group for social proof
Platform introduction via trusted group member
relationship_building.duration: Extended period (group joining through trading to exit attempt)

platform_introduction.introduction_method: Personal recommendation from Mona with detailed instructions
instructions_provided: How to transfer assets to platform

deposit_methods: Purchase crypto assets from legitimate exchange

pressure_campaign.tactic: Mona repeatedly asked when victim would deposit more money
pressure_campaign.behavioral_shift: Changed from advisor to aggressive salesperson
pressure_campaign.significance: Red flag that triggered withdrawal attempt

tactics: Victim became suspicious of deposit pressure
Received false confirmation message from platform

purpose: Suggest technical issue rather than fraud

victim_responses: Became suspicious of repeated deposit requests
red_flags: Behavioral change from helpful to pushy
Inability to contact platform or Mona

impact_assessment.reporting: California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation

phase_1_targeting.method: Dual-vector social engineering with group validation

phase_2_engagement.technique: Personal coaching relationship with group social proof

phase_4_exploitation.outcome: Complete loss of funds, platform shutdown

initial_access.technique: T1566.002 - Phishing: Spearphishing Link / T1566.003 - Phishing: Spearphishing via Service
initial_access.description: WhatsApp group-based social engineering with individual contact

execution.description: Victims voluntarily transfer crypto based on group and personal trust

persistence.technique: T1098 - Account Manipulation / T1136 - Create Account
persistence.description: WhatsApp group membership, platform account, ongoing Mona relationship

privilege_escalation.description: Group admin controls, platform authority, advisor positioning

defense_evasion.technique: T1027 - Obfuscated Files or Information / T1036 - Masquerading
defense_evasion.description: Group-based legitimacy, false confirmations, professional platform design

credential_access.description: Platform account creation with victim credentials

discovery.technique: T1087 - Account Discovery / T1069 - Permission Groups Discovery
discovery.description: Gathering victim financial capacity through conversation

collection.technique: T1005 - Data from Local System / T1114 - Email Collection
collection.description: Multiple crypto asset transfers, victim information

impact.technique: T1485 - Data Destruction / T1499 - Endpoint Denial of Service
impact.description: Financial theft via false confirmation and exit scam

coordination_indicators: Individual operators like Mona providing coaching
Synchronized exit (group, Mona, platform all disappear)

detection: Be extremely cautious of WhatsApp investment groups
Research unfamiliar platform names and domains
Be suspicious of personal investment advice from group members
Watch for repeated deposit pressure as RED FLAG
Verify withdrawal confirmations with actual fund receipt
prevention: Avoid investment opportunities from messaging app groups
Never trust personal advisors met in investment groups
Research platforms through official regulatory sources
Be wary of step-by-step guidance to transfer funds
Recognize social proof in groups may be manufactured
Exit immediately if advisor pressures additional deposits
Verify all withdrawal confirmations before assuming success
response: Document all WhatsApp group and individual communications
Save screenshots of platform and confirmations
Report WhatsApp group and Mona's account
Warn other group members if still accessible
Share domain and contact info with anti-scam communities
Do not respond to any recovery scam offers
red_flag_checklist: Investment opportunity from WhatsApp group = HIGH RISK
Behavioral shift from helpful to pushy
Withdrawal confirmation but no funds received
